form.preferredDefinition: The interviewer asks the respondent for his/her date of birth in MM/DD/YYYY format. If the respondent does not know his/her date of birth the interviewer asks an alternative question to determine his/her age. NOTE: The current age of the respondent can be calculated, given the date of the interview.

question.questionText: What is your birthdate? (birthdate)
birthdate coded (birthdate_coded)
About how old are you? (age)
age coded (age_coded)

protocol.preferredDefinition: The interviewer asks the respondent for his/her date of birth in MM/DD/YYYY format. If the respondent does not know his/her date of birth the interviewer asks an alternative question to determine his/her age. NOTE: The current age of the respondent can be calculated, given the date of the interview.

form.preferredDefinition: The respondent completes the self-administered questionnaire by indicating his or her place of birth. If he or she was born in the United States, an additional question captures the state, if known. If he or she was not born in the United States another open-ended question asks for this location.

question.questionText: Where were you born? (birthplace)

Where were you born? In the United States Print name of state. Outside the United States Print U.S. Territory (e.g., Puerto Rico, U.S. Virgin Islands, Guam) or name of foreign country etc. (birthplace_location)

protocol.preferredDefinition: The respondent completes the self-administered questionnaire by indicating his or her place of birth. If he or she was born in the United States, an additional question captures the state, if known. If he or she was not born in the United States another open-ended question asks for this location.

form.preferredDefinition: The respondent completes the self-administered questionnaire by indicating his or her biological mother's place of birth. If he or she was born in the United States, an additional question captures the state, if known. If he or she was not born in the United States another open-ended question asks for this location.The same procedures would be followed for obtaining the birthplace of the respondent's father.

question.questionText: Where was your biological mother born? (mother_birthplace)

Where was your biological mother born? In the United States Print name of state Outside the United States Print U.S. Territory (e.g., Puerto Rico, U.S. Virgin Islands, Guam) or name of foreign country etc. (mother_birthplace_location)
Where was your biological father born? (father_birthplace)

Where was your biological father born? In the United States Print name of state Outside the United States Print U.S. Territory (e.g., Puerto Rico, U.S. Virgin Islands, Guam) or name of foreign country etc. (father_birthplace_location)

protocol.preferredDefinition: The respondent completes the self-administered questionnaire by indicating his or her biological mother's place of birth. If he or she was born in the United States, an additional question captures the state, if known. If he or she was not born in the United States another open-ended question asks for this location.The same procedures would be followed for obtaining the birthplace of the respondent's father.

form.preferredDefinition: The respondent completes the self-administered questionnaire by indicating his or her maternal grandmother's place of birth. If he or she was born in the United States, an additional question captures the state, if known. If he or she was not born in the United States, another open-ended question asks for this location.The same procedures would be followed for obtaining the birthplace of the respondent's maternal grandfather, paternal grandmother, and paternal grandfather.

question.questionText: Where was your mother's mother born? (maternal_grandmother_birthplace)

Where was your mother's mother born? In the United States Print name of state Outside the United States Print U.S. Territory (e.g., Puerto Rico, U.S. Virgin Islands, Guam) or name of foreign country etc. (maternal_grandmother_birthplace_location)
Where was your mother's father born? (maternal_grandfather_birthplace)

Where was your mother's father born? In the United States Print name of state Outside the United States Print U.S. Territory (e.g., Puerto Rico, U.S. Virgin Islands, Guam) or name of foreign country etc. (maternal_grandfather_birthplace_location)
Where was your father's mother born? (paternal_grandmother_birthplace)

Where was your father's mother born? In the United States Print name of state Outside the United States Print U.S. Territory (e.g., Puerto Rico, U.S. Virgin Islands, Guam) or name of foreign country etc. (paternal_grandmother_birthplace_location)
Where was your father's father born? (paternal_grandfather_birthplace)

Where was your mother's father born? In the United States Print name of state Outside the United States Print U.S. Territory (e.g., Puerto Rico, U.S. Virgin Islands, Guam) or name of foreign country etc. (paternal_grandfather_birthplace_location)

protocol.preferredDefinition: The respondent completes the self-administered questionnaire by indicating his or her maternal grandmother's place of birth. If he or she was born in the United States, an additional question captures the state, if known. If he or she was not born in the United States, another open-ended question asks for this location.The same procedures would be followed for obtaining the birthplace of the respondent's maternal grandfather, paternal grandmother, and paternal grandfather.

form.preferredDefinition: The interviewer asks the respondent (or proxy) to indicate his/her gender.

question.questionText: Are you male or female? (gender)

protocol.preferredDefinition: The interviewer asks the respondent (or proxy) to indicate his/her gender.

form.preferredDefinition: The interviewer reads the respondent's current address aloud for the respondent. Information is verified with the respondent and recorded.

question.questionText: I would like to verify your address. Please give me your complete address. STREET Number (current_street_number)
I would like to verify your address. Please give me your complete address. STREET NAME (current_street_name)
I would like to verify your address. Please give me your complete address. Apartment Number (current_apartment_number)
I would like to verify your address. Please give me your complete address. CITY (current_city)
I would like to verify your address. Please give me your complete address. STATE (current_state)
I would like to verify your address. Please give me your complete address. Zip Code (zip_code)
I would like to verify your address. Please give me your complete address. (address_refused_enum)

protocol.preferredDefinition: The interviewer reads the respondent's current address aloud for the respondent. Information is verified with the respondent and recorded.

form.preferredDefinition: The interviewer asks the respondent or proxy about his/her education completed to date. The respondent is asked to indicate the highest grade level or degree received at the time of the interview. A card with the categories printed on it is provided to the respondent for him/her to indicate one of the applicable categories.

question.questionText: What is the highest grade or level of school you have completed or the highest degree you have received? [HAND CARD DMQ1. READ HAND CARD CATEGORIES IF NECESSARY. ENTER HIGHEST LEVEL OF SCHOOL.] (current_educational_attainment)

validValue.meaningText: ASSOCIATE DEGREE: OCCUPATIONAL, TECHNICAL, OR VOCATIONAL PROGRAM
validValue.description: ASSOCIATE DEGREE: OCCUPATIONAL, TECHNICAL, OR VOCATIONAL PROGRAM

validValue.meaningText: BACHELOR'S DEGREE (EXAMPLE: BA, AB, BS, BBA)
validValue.description: BACHELOR'S DEGREE (EXAMPLE: BA, AB, BS, BBA)

validValue.meaningText: MASTER'S DEGREE (EXAMPLE: MA, MS, MEng, MEd, MBA)
validValue.description: MASTER'S DEGREE (EXAMPLE: MA, MS, MEng, MEd, MBA)

validValue.meaningText: PROFESSIONAL SCHOOL DEGREE (EXAMPLE: MD, DDS, DVM, JD)
validValue.description: PROFESSIONAL SCHOOL DEGREE (EXAMPLE: MD, DDS, DVM, JD)

protocol.preferredDefinition: The interviewer asks the respondent or proxy about his/her education completed to date. The respondent is asked to indicate the highest grade level or degree received at the time of the interview. A card with the categories printed on it is provided to the respondent for him/her to indicate one of the applicable categories.

form.preferredDefinition: The interviewer asks the respondent about his/her family's total income from all sources in the last calendar year. This is an open-ended question. Respondents who don't know or refuse to answer the first annual family income question are asked a series of bracketing questions to obtain the approximate amount.

question.questionText: What was your best estimate of the total income of all family members from all sources, before taxes, in last year? (annual_family_income)
What was your best estimate of the total income of all family members from all sources, before taxes, in last year? (annual_family_income_coded)
Was your total family income from all sources less than $50,000 or $50,000 or more? (annual_family_income_50k)
Was your total family income from all sources less than $35,000 or $35,000 or more? (annual_family_income_35k)
Was your total family income from all sources less than poverty threshold or more? (annual_family_income_poverty_threshold)
Was your total family income from all sources less than $100,000 or $100,000 or more? (annual_family_income_100k)
Was your total family income from all sources less than $75,000 or $75,000 or more? (annual_family_income_75k)

protocol.preferredDefinition: The interviewer asks the respondent about his/her family's total income from all sources in the last calendar year. This is an open-ended question. Respondents who don't know or refuse to answer the first annual family income question are asked a series of bracketing questions to obtain the approximate amount.

form.longName: PhenX PX011201 - Years Living In The Us
form.preferredDefinition: The interviewer asks the respondent how long he/she has been in the United States, in years. The number of years (2 digits) is entered by the interviewer. If the respondent has been in the United States for less than 1 year, the entry is "0."

question.questionText: About how long have you been in the United States? (years_living_in_us)
About how long have you been in the United States? (years_living_in_us_coded)

protocol.preferredDefinition: The interviewer asks the respondent how long he/she has been in the United States, in years. The number of years (2 digits) is entered by the interviewer. If the respondent has been in the United States for less than 1 year, the entry is "0."

form.preferredDefinition: The interviewer asks the respondent about his/her current employment status.

question.questionText: We would like to know about what you do are you working now, looking for work, retired, keeping house, a student, or what? (current_employment_status)

validValue.meaningText: ONLY TEMPORARILY LAID OFF, SICK LEAVE OR MATERNITY LEAVE
validValue.description: ONLY TEMPORARILY LAID OFF, SICK LEAVE OR MATERNITY LEAVE

question.questionText: current employment status, Other specify (cur_employ_stat_specify)

protocol.preferredDefinition: The interviewer asks the respondent about his/her current employment status.

form.preferredDefinition: The individual stands against the wall with his or her arms outstretched at shoulder level. Measurement of the arm span is the maximum distance between the extended middle fingers of the right and left hands, measured across the back.

module.longName: This protocol is part of an examination survey. It requires a tape measure at least 2 m long, a flat surface (usually a wall), and an adjustable block that is fixed to the wall. The spool of the tape measure is fixed to the adjustable block. The block serves as the contact point for the middle (longest) finger of the right hand, which is in contact with the block when the participant is positioned. The block must be movable so that it can be adjusted vertically to accommodate individuals of varying stature. The block is adjusted to bring the tape to the shoulder level for the subject, and then the tape is pulled horizontally along the wall. The participant stands with the feet together so that his or her back is against the wall. The arms are outstretched laterally and maximally at the level of the shoulders, in contact with the wall, and with the palms facing forward. The tip of the middle (longest) finger (excluding the fingernail) of the right hand is kept in contact with the block, while the zero end of the tape is set at the tip of the middle (longest) finger (excluding the fingernail) of the left hand. Two people (measurers) are necessary, one at the zero end of the tape to be sure the tape end is positioned correctly and the other at the block end to make the reading. The measurement is recorded to the nearest 0.1 cm (1/4"). Occasionally, a small stool may be required for the measurers to make this measurement on tall subjects (when the measurer is shorter than the study subject). When making this measurement, it is imperative that the participant's arms be outstretched maximally and that they are held in this position until the reading is taken. Special care must be taken with young children and older individuals as they tend to lower their arms during the measurement.* Please note that there might be high levels of participant discomfort (see Burden Table) for the elderly and young children who may not be as flexible.
module.preferredDefinition: This protocol is part of an examination survey. It requires a tape measure at least 2 m long, a flat surface (usually a wall), and an adjustable block that is fixed to the wall. The spool of the tape measure is fixed to the adjustable block. The block serves as the contact point for the middle (longest) finger of the right hand, which is in contact with the block when the participant is positioned. The block must be movable so that it can be adjusted vertically to accommodate individuals of varying stature. The block is adjusted to bring the tape to the shoulder level for the subject, and then the tape is pulled horizontally along the wall. The participant stands with the feet together so that his or her back is against the wall. The arms are outstretched laterally and maximally at the level of the shoulders, in contact with the wall, and with the palms facing forward. The tip of the middle (longest) finger (excluding the fingernail) of the right hand is kept in contact with the block, while the zero end of the tape is set at the tip of the middle (longest) finger (excluding the fingernail) of the left hand. Two people (measurers) are necessary, one at the zero end of the tape to be sure the tape end is positioned correctly and the other at the block end to make the reading. The measurement is recorded to the nearest 0.1 cm (1/4"). Occasionally, a small stool may be required for the measurers to make this measurement on tall subjects (when the measurer is shorter than the study subject). When making this measurement, it is imperative that the participant's arms be outstretched maximally and that they are held in this position until the reading is taken. Special care must be taken with young children and older individuals as they tend to lower their arms during the measurement.* Please note that there might be high levels of participant discomfort (see Burden Table) for the elderly and young children who may not be as flexible.

question.questionText: Arm Span measured in centimeter, first measurement. (arm_span_1)
Arm Span measured in centimeter, second measurement (arm_span_2)

Arm Span measured in centimeter, third measurement. A third measurement should be taken if the first two measurements differed by greater than1.0 cm (1/4") for participants 12 years or older or greater than0.5 cm (1/8") for participants 11 years and younger. (arm_span_3)

Average Arm Span measurement. If it is necessary to take a third measurement, the two closest measurements are averaged. Should the third measurement fall equally between the first two measurements, all three should be averaged. (arm_span_average)

protocol.preferredDefinition: The individual stands against the wall with his or her arms outstretched at shoulder level. Measurement of the arm span is the maximum distance between the extended middle fingers of the right and left hands, measured across the back.
